title: Bwin confirms offer from rival GVC
text:
Bwin confirms 110p a share offer from Aim rival GVC Joel Lewin and Jeremy Grant ©FT 
Bwin.party, the Gibraltar-based online gaming group, has confirmed it has received an initial offer of 110p per share from its smaller Aim-listed rival GVC Holdings. 
Bwin on Thursday acknowledged the GVC move, saying its board had considered the offer, “the potential benefits of which it believes can accrue to bwin.party shareholders from a combination of the two companies and the commitment shown to resolving a number of transaction-related issues”. More MSC Cruises to base ship in Havana 
The group announced that it had decided to “work with GVC so that they can finalise their offer over the coming days”. 
The Financial Times recently reported that GVC, in conjunction with Canada’s Amaya Group, had offered more than £900m to buy Bwin. 
The move is another sign that deals are reshaping the UK’s online gaming business. Last month Playtech, a gambling software company, signed a deal to buy Plus500, a London-listed online contracts for difference broker. 
The news came as Bwin reported revenue in the three months to June was in line with expectations, and said that mobile “has continued to grow strongly”. 
It said the proportion of revenue generated by mobile in June rose to 31 per cent, up from 23 per cent in the same period last year. 
Meanwhile the proportion of sales generated by sports betting rose to more than 50 per cent in June, up from 37 per cent in the same month last year despite the fact that last summer sports revenue was boosted by the football World Cup. 
However, Bwin said unfavourable sporting results drove margins lower. 
Norbert Teufelberger, chief executive said: “Despite challenging comparatives ... we are pleased with our business performance in the first half. We have completed our new organisational set-up and streamlined our decision-making processes, significantly improving our operational performance.” Related Topics Copyright The Financial Times Limited 2015.
